articles.author: Andrew Chung
articles.description: A challenge to the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's powers to protect investors from fraud comes before the Supreme Court on Wednesday in another in a series of legal attacks against federal agencies that regulate financial markets.
articles.title: SEC's in-house enforcement powers at risk in US Supreme Court case

articles.author: Lefteris Papadimas
articles.description: Greece will next month repay ahead of schedule 5.3 billion euros ($5.8 billion) of loans owed to euro zone countries under its first bailout, and hopes to repeat the move in 2024, finance ministry officials told Reuters on Tuesday.
articles.title: Exclusive: Greece to repay more euro zone bailout loans ahead of schedule

articles.author: Kane Wu, Anirban Sen
articles.description: Fashion company Shein has confidentially filed to go public in the United States, according to two sources familiar with the matter, in what is likely to be one of the most valuable China-founded companies to list in New York.
articles.title: China's Shein files for US IPO in major test for investor appetite - sources

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The rapid adoption of artificial intelligence could reduce wages, but so far is creating, not destroying jobs, especially for the young and highly-skilled, research published by the European Central Bank showed on Tuesday.
articles.title: AI threatens wages, not jobs - so far, ECB paper finds

articles.author: Suzanne McGee
articles.description: Despite growing excitement that spot bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs) will soon win regulatory approval, some cryptocurrency ETF pioneers plan to sit out what is expected to be a fierce industry battle for market share.
articles.title: In spot bitcoin ETF race, some pioneers stick to the sidelines

articles.author: Clark Mindock
articles.description: A U.S. appeals court on Monday handed 3M (MMM.N), Corteva Inc (CTVA.N) subsidiary E.I. du Pont de Nemours and Co and other manufactures of toxic so-called "forever chemicals" a big win in their fight against legal liability for the substances, rejecting a lower court's ruling that would have allowed about 11.8 million Ohio residents to sue the companies as a group.
articles.title: 3M, DuPont defeat massive class action over forever chemicals

articles.author: Foo Yun Chee
articles.description: Meta Platforms' (META.O) paid no-ads subscription service launched in Europe this month faced one of its biggest tests as advocacy group NOYB on Tuesday filed a complaint with an Austrian regulator, saying that it amounted to paying a fee to ensure privacy.
articles.title: Exclusive: Meta Platforms' paid ad-free service targeted in Austrian privacy complaint

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Emily Rose
articles.description: An Israel-Hamas truce in Gaza was poised to stretch into a fifth day on Tuesday amid expectations the Islamist group will free more of the hostages it seized on Oct. 7 in return for greater aid flows and Israel's release of imprisoned Palestinians.
articles.title: More Israeli hostages, Palestinians expected to be freed with extended truce

articles.author: Valerie Volcovici
articles.description: In Texas, oil and gas producer Occidental Petroleum (OXY.N) is constructing a giant facility to suck 500,000 tonnes of carbon dioxide out of the atmosphere annually to keep it from warming the climate, a project backed by hundreds of millions of dollars from investment firm BlackRock (BLK.N).
articles.title: Two US projects highlight divide over carbon removal’s role in climate fight

articles.author: Laurie Chen, Jessie Pang
articles.description: One year after "white paper" protests flared across China against stringent COVID restrictions, Yicheng Huang fears this rare show of public dissent may eventually be forgotten by the Chinese public amid state censorship.
articles.title: One year on, China's COVID protesters caught between hope and apathy
